text: Amos Luzzatto (3 June 1928 – 9 September 2020) was an Italian-Jewish writer and essayist. He was one of the most important representatives of Jewish Italian culture in the 20th century.Samuel David Luzzatto (1800–65) was an Italian historian, theologian, and biblical exegete, known, after the initial letters of his Hebrew name, as Shadal. Shadal was one of the pioneers of the Judische Wissenschaft movement, contributing many studies in Jewish history to learned periodicals and producing a critical edition of the Italian Prayer Book He was teaching at the Rabbinical College in Padua and was an Italian representative of the "Wissenschaft des Judentums". He was born in Rome. From June 1998 to February 2006, he was the President of the Union of Italian Jewish Communities. Luzzatto died on 9 September 2020 in Venice, Italy at the age of 92.Morto Amos Luzzatto, ex presidente della Comunità ebraica italiana ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Italian essayists Category:Writers from Rome
